results.title: Association between statins exposure and risk of skin cancer: an updated meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: Further subgroup analysis of the subtypes of statins revealed that compared with the non-exposed group, exposure to @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@lovastatin@@@ (OR: 1.18, P = 0.048) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (OR: 1.11, P < 0.001) was a risk factor for @<m>DISEASE_Skin_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012878 @@@skin cancer@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang D, Dai S, Lou D, Wang T, Wang S, Zheng Z. Association between statins exposure and risk of skin cancer: an updated meta-analysis. Int J Dermatol. 2023 Sep 8;():. PMID: 37681467

results.title: Relation of statin use with non-melanoma skin cancer: prospective results from the Women's Health Initiative
results.text_hl: ...The first two @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ trials suggested an association with @<m>DISEASE_Skin_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012878 @@@NMSC@@@ seen more often in treatment groups.
